articles.title: UK coronavirus live: Boris Johnson 'against lifting lockdown over second wave fears' - The Guardian

articles.author: By Georgia Simcox For Mailonline
articles.title: Elon Musk's Starlink satellites cause stir as they streak through skies of western Europe - Daily Mail
articles.description: A video shows a line of the Starlink satellites trailing through the sky in western Europe. Starlink is the informal name for Musk's Space X's project. It's goal is to help to improve internet service.
articles.content:
Elon Musk's SpaceX has launched the fifth batch of its 'Starlink' space internet satellites - taking the total to 300.
They form a constellation of thousands of satellites, designed to provide low-cost broadband internet service from low Earth orbit.
The co… [+1907 chars]

articles.title: Bloodbath fears as violent biker gangs battle for supremacy on streets - Mirror Online
articles.description: Motorcycle gangs Blue Angels and Nomads have been involved in a string of violent attacks and it is feared more incidents could take place - even resulting in someone dying
articles.content:

articles.title: A first: Repair spacecraft brings aging satellite back to life - TechSpot
articles.description: Northrop Grumman’s recent mission introduced a lot of firsts: the MEV-1 is the first spacecraft designed with repair functionality in mind, its docking to the IS-901 was the first between commercial equipment in geostationary orbit, and the IS-901 (as photogr…
articles.content:
In brief: The Northrop Grumman Mission Extension Vehicle One (MEV-1) has docked with the Intelsat 901 satellite, restored it, and pushed it into the right orbit. The formerly retired communications satellite is now fully operational and in use.

articles.title: China wants a piece of the moon. Here's how it plans to handle lunar samples. - Space.com
articles.description: The nation plans to launch the Chang'e 5 sample-return mission to the moon later this year.

articles.author: Ciaran McGrath
articles.title: Oumuamua: 'Weird' interstellar object may be alien probe, says Avi Loeb - Express.co.uk
articles.description: PHYSICIST Professor Avi Loeb has restated his belief that Oumuamua, the mysterious interstellar object which shot through our solar system in 2018, may be an alien probe, more than 18 months after the bizarrely shaped interloper made its fleeting appearance.
